Interface ec.meta.Obj

public interface interface Obj
extends Tether
This is the interface which all objects wishing to live in the ec.meta world must implement. In general, they do so by extending ec.meta.StdObj, but not necessarily. In particular Deflectors do not inherit from StdObj.

See Also:
Deflector, StdObj

consistencyCheck()
Do a consistency check.
getCla()
This is the approved replacement for Object.getClass().
getDeflectorCla()
Get the Cla for the deflector to use with this Cla.
getHash()
This is the approved replacement for Object.hashCode().
getString()
This is the approved replacement for Object.toString().
isEqual(Object)
This is the approved replacement for Object.equals().
respond()
Tell the given object to respond with itself.

getCla 
 public abstract Cla getCla()
This is the approved replacement for Object.getClass().

Returns:
s the Cla of this object
getHash 
 public abstract int getHash()
This is the approved replacement for Object.hashCode().

Returns:
the hash of this object
isEqual 
 public abstract boolean isEqual(Object other)
This is the approved replacement for Object.equals().

Parameters:
other - the object to compare to
Returns:
whether the two objects should be considered equal
getString 
 public abstract String getString()
This is the approved replacement for Object.toString().

Returns:
the stringified form of the object
respond 
 public abstract Object respond()
Tell the given object to respond with itself. This is used for shortening channel chains.

Returns:
the "actual" object
getDeflectorCla 
 public abstract Cla getDeflectorCla()
Get the Cla for the deflector to use with this Cla.

Returns:
the deflector Cla
consistencyCheck 
 public abstract void consistencyCheck() throws InconsistentException
Do a consistency check. By default, this does nothing, but subclasses should override it (always calling the supermethod, though) to perform their specific checks.

Throws: InconsistentException
thrown if the consistency check fails.
